snippet: As states finalize what benefits they want guaranteed under the new health care law, it is becoming increasingly clear that what services are received will vary in part by location.
abstract: Main goal of new health care law is to guarantee medical coverage to nearly all Americans, but as states finalize their insurance benefits packages, it is becoming clear that what services are received will depend partly on location; interest groups are lobbying in different states to add services like chiropractor care and infertility treatments to package of essential benefits insurance must cover under the law.
lead_paragraph: As states finalize what benefits they want guaranteed under the new health care law, it is becoming increasingly clear that what services are received will vary in part by location.

headline.seo: Interest Groups Push to Fill Margins of Health Coverage
headline.main: Interest Groups Push to Fill Margins of Health Coverage
headline.print_headline: Interest Groups Push to Fill Margins of Health Coverage
